H0.text: Tension is the capacity for which steel is used for cables in suspension bridges.

H1.text: Torsion is the capacity for steel that makes it suitable for cables in suspension bridges.

H2.text: Compression is the property that makes steel suitable for cables in suspension bridges.

H3.text: Contraction is the capacity of steel that makes it suitable for use as cables in suspension bridges.

A4.text: The main cables must be anchored at each end of the bridge, since any load applied to the bridge is transformed into tension in these main cables.

A5.text: The failure of a single eyebar was found to be the cause of the collapse of the Silver Bridge over the Ohio River.
